pullRequest.title: Leader election rate
pullRequest.bodyText:
Goals (and why):
Add a health check on leader election rate. This will be useful for moving TimeLock to blue-green upgrade model.
Implementation Description (bullets):


Move LeadershipEvents metrics to metric-schema.


Add a health check on rate of leader health checks.


Testing (What was existing testing like?  What have you done to improve it?):

Added a test for leader election health check

Concerns (what feedback would you like?):

Is the HealthCheck threshold estimate reasonable?

Where should we start reviewing?:

LeaderElectionHealthCheck, LeadershipEvents

Priority (whenever / two weeks / yesterday):

Before end of week

nodes.bodyText: How hard would it be to add a test?
This means 5 in the last minute? or 5 in the last 5 minutes?
nodes.diffHunk:

+
+import com.palantir.leader.LeaderElectionServiceMetrics;
+import com.palantir.tritium.metrics.registry.TaggedMetricRegistry;
+
+public class LeaderElectionHealthCheck {
+    private static final double MAX_ALLOWED_5_MIN_RATE = 5;

nodes.bodyText: It may be good to say what the metrics are, as opposed to what specifically they do.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+options:
+  javaPackage: 'com.palantir.leader'
+
+namespaces:
+  leaderElectionService:
+    docs: Metrics helpful for TimeLock adjudication.

nodes.bodyText: nit: remember to clean this up
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+type: improvement
+improvement:
+  description: |-
+    This change adds a health check to track the leader election rate on TimeLock.
+    <!---
+    Please remember to:
+    - Add any necessary release notes (including breaking changes)
+    - Make sure the documentation is up to date for your change
+    --->

nodes.bodyText: This feels a bit high: one election per second is pretty unstable. Based on metrics we've seen internally I think we want this to be maybe one in 30 seconds?

nodes.bodyText: Sorry - despite the comment I'm not sure what the significance of the 6 seconds here is?
nit: I'd pass Duration into markLeaderElections(...) for readability
nit: the name of the constant implies <=?
(I think we still need to fix this in round 2)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+options:
+  javaPackage: 'com.palantir.leader'
+
+namespaces:
+  leaderElectionService:
+    docs: Metrics helpful for TimeLock adjudication.

nodes.bodyText: We should standardise between Number of times(per second) and Rate. I think I slightly prefer the former - or maybe Rate (frequency per second)?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+options:
+  javaPackage: 'com.palantir.leader'
+
+namespaces:
+  leaderElectionService:
+    docs: Metrics helpful for TimeLock adjudication.
+    metrics:
+      gainedLeadership:
+        type: meter
+        docs: Number of times(per second) leadership was gained successully.
+      lostLeadership:
+        type: meter
+        docs: Number of times(per second) leadership was lost.
+      noQuorum:
+        type: meter
+        docs: Number of times(per second) there was no quorum while determining leadership status.
+      proposedLeadership:
+        type: meter
+        docs: Number of times(per second) leadership was proposed.
+      proposalFailure:
+        type: meter
+        docs: Number of times(per second) leadership could not be gained after proposal.

commit.message: Move leader election metrics to metric-schema
Exclude generated metric schema from License violation check
